title: ğŸš€ SONIC: Open-Source 42M-Parameter Transformer for Real-Time Whole-Body Humanoid Control (NVIDIA Robotics)

sources.author: DrJimFan
sources.text: What can half of GPT-1 do? We trained a 42M transformer called SONIC to control the body of a humanoid robot. It takes a remarkable amount of subconscious processing for us humans to squat, turn, craw

sources.author: DrJimFan
sources.text: We trained a humanoid with 22-DoF dexterous hands to assemble model cars, operate syringes, sort poker cards, fold/roll shirts, all learned primarily from 20,000+ hours of egocentric human video with

sources.author: DrJimFan
sources.text:
This is a huge team work at NVIDIA Robotics. Check out @ruijie_zheng12's deep dive: 

- Website: https://t.co/n3Zp8bh8Ht
- Paper: https://t.co/eXQqSl3GHg

https://t.co/ybup5DhSCM

key_facts: SONIC is a 42M-parameter transformer trained on 100M+ mocap frames and 500,000+ parallel simulated robots, enabling zero-shot transfer to real Unitree G1 with 100% success across 50 diverse motion sequences
It unifies multimodal control â€” text prompts ('dance like a monkey'), live webcam video, VR teleoperation, music audio, and integration with VLA models like GR00T N1.5 (95% mobile task success)
Built on NVIDIA Isaac Lab with 10,000Ã— accelerated physics simulation; trained in just 3 days on 128 GPUs
Full code, model checkpoints, and EgoScale dexterity framework (leveraging 20,000+ hours of egocentric human video) are open-sourced
Demonstrates log-linear scaling law (RÂ² = 0.998) between human video volume and robot action prediction loss â€” establishing human embodiment as the most scalable supervision signal
analyst_angle: This isnâ€™t just another robot controller â€” itâ€™s a paradigm shift: open-sourcing a production-grade, multimodal, zero-shot humanoid policy trained *entirely* on human data signals the end of hand-engineered reward functions and the rise of human-centric embodied AI as the dominant path to general robot intelligence.

key_facts: Alibaba Cloud officially launched Qwen-3.5 Plus â€” a native multimodal large language model with 397B total parameters and only 17B active during inference.
Features include Hybrid Architecture (Gated Delta Networks + Sparse MoE), true multimodality (GUI, video, agentic workflows), and support for 200+ languages.
Qwen-3.5-397B-A17B is open-weight, targeting developers and enterprises building AI agents; coding plan starts at $5/month.
The model powers enterprise solutions like Eagle AI (deployed with AstraZeneca) via Alibaba Cloud Model Studio.
analyst_angle: This launch signals a strategic shift toward cost-efficient, production-grade multimodal agents â€” challenging the 'bigger is better' paradigm with sparse, adaptive inference while accelerating open adoption of sovereign AI infrastructure.
